heroDescription: Boston, a historic city, is a hub for education, healthcare, and technology.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 645,966, Boston's economy thrives on education, healthcare, and finance. The city is home to numerous startups and established firms.
uniqueNeeds: Boston requires a focus on education, healthcare, and tech innovation to sustain growth.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Boston's tech sector needs diversification to mitigate downturns. Housing prices pose bubble risks, while winter storms and flooding are natural hazards. Economic diversification is essential.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Boston's GDP grew by 3.2% driven by tech and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Boston is $75,000, reflecting a diverse economic base.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Boston are increasingly specializing in tech and healthcare investments.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Boston's cost of living is 20% higher than the national average, driven by housing and healthcare costs.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Boston's real estate market remains competitive, with median home prices around $700,000.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Boston ranks high for startups, particularly in biotech and software development.
